comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I can see what you mean NLI, it does have a very Dickensian feel to it.  What we of the 21st century need to remember is that there was very little change in the mode of dress, means of transport and building methods between the end of the 17th and beginning of the 20th centuries.  The first supermarkets were opened in my lifetime and shopping malls and superstores are really a recent innovation.  It is an excellent shot and very atmospheric!!

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/39191857@N05] I'd agree, this pic is certainly pre-1900. Also, notice the cast-iron water pump in the foreground, of the type still seen around the country today. I like the gas lamp on the house corner too. Here's a view of the same location (approx) on Google Street-View maps.google.com/maps?q=Arundel+Square,+Waterford,+Ireland... All the building seen on the right have gone. Stuart.

comment._content: Arundel Gate and castle was in the laneway on the extreme right in the picture.
